newsitem.title: USA: Crystal Systems shrs seen rising further.
newsitem.headline: Crystal Systems shrs seen rising further.

text.p: Crystal Systems Solutions Ltd shares have been climbing steadily since the company went public in January, and at least one analyst expects the stock to continue to rise, Business Week magazine reported.

In the Inside Wall Street column in its June 2 issue, the magazine said Crystal is a "pure play" in the business of providing solutions for computers that cannot process information for the year 2000 and beyond.
The company's products handle the conversion and testing component for companies making the "Year 2000" upgrade.
Crystal shares were up 1-1/4 to 22-7/8 on the Nasdaq.
Fran Saldutti, a money manager at Ardent Partners, was quoted by Business Week as saying he expects the stock to rise to at least 30.

The column said Crystal, which went public on January 31, has a partnership with Ernst & Young that has helped it develop an enviable list of customers, including Ford Motor Co, Eastman Kodak Co and Union Pacific Corp.
